body.p: Using bookmarks, you are able to mark a position in an edited document so that you can return to it after further editing and browsing through one or more documents opened at the same time. You can place up to nine distinct bookmarks in any opened document. Configurable shortcut key strokes are available to place bookmarks and to return to any of the marked positions. To configure these keys, go to Options Menu shortcut keys .
Quickly switching to a position marked by a bookmark can be done by Edit Bookmarks ->Go to.

Two contextual menu actions are available:
Remove Removes the current bookmark.
Remove all Removes all bookmarks set in the document.
